messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:56): http://www.w3.org/TR/MathML/chapter3.html#id.3.5.1.2
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:56): allowed values are (top | bottom | center | baseline | axis) [ rownumber ]
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:57): where [ rownumber ] is an optional number that can be appended to "top", "bottom", etc.?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:57): can that really be?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:58): attribute align {xsd:string {
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:58): pattern ='\s*(top|bottom|center|baseline|axis)\s*[0-9]*'}}?
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (10:11): sounds funky
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (10:11): gsnedders‚Äô outliner doesn‚Äôt show implicit sectioning does it
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (10:14): hrm‚Ä¶ still not sure if I understand implied sections :/
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (10:15): <h1>foo</h1><h2>hi, i'm in an implied section</h1>
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (10:16): d‚Äôoh! gsnedders‚Äô outliner does show implied sections, but only those without typos
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (10:16): obviously the mind-reading update hasn‚Äôt happened yet
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (10:17): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: I kinda understand the theory, but I‚Äôm not *feelin‚Äô it* ye
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (10:18): it‚Äôs basically an error correction mechanism, right? for UGE
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (10:18): (user-generated errors)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:21): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: curious that they allow whitespace before but not after
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:21): not after the number
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:21): but before the text
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:23): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: the more I see of that vocabulary the more it scares me

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (10:24): another outlining q: using <body><article><h1>title</h1>‚Ä¶ gives a root ‚ÄúUntitled section‚Äù. wassup with that? we‚Äôre meant to add a heading element outside sectioning content? I don‚Äôt get where it‚Äôs coming from
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:24): anyway, it seems clear there are some more deficiencies in that MathML 2.0 rng schema
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:25): I'm wondering if it would be easier to just start with the MathML 3.0 one and remove stuff
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:25): maybe I should ping David Carlisle and ask
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:25): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: Implied sections are basically HTML4
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:26): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: The <body> element is also a sectioning element
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (10:26): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: aah! I forgot about sectioning root. doh
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (10:26): So if you have <body><h1>My funky site</h1><article><h1>My article everything works
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (10:27): outlining algorithm needs to be communicated by mind-meld. explaining it in writing is brutal
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:28): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: have you filed the scary stuff as spec bugs against MathML 3?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:28): I guess I should
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:28): I just wonder if any of this stuff is actually supported
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:29): I mean, what does align=baseline3 even mean?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:29): has no idea
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:33): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: btw, you got my question from the other day about hooking v.nu HTML5 parser into other java apps?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:33): http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/whatwg/20100602#l-181
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:34): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I've missed that bit in the logs
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:35): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: you need a DocumentBuilderFactory that instantiates HtmlDocumentBuilder
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:35): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I haven't supplied one, because I wasn't aware of people actually needing one
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:36): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I was thinking it would be useful for anybody who wants to just use the HTML5 parser in place of whatever existing XML one
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:36): e.g., with Saxon
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:36): I thought they'd just do new HtmlDocumentBuilder
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:36): or jing or whatever
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:36): I didn't realize people actually want the factory stuff
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:36): I mean using it from the command-line
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:36): but yeah, that would be doable
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:37): should I open a bug for it?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:37): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: yes, please

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:43): sax/HtmlParser ?
